name: Neeraj Chopra
biography: Neeraj Chopra is an Indian track and field athlete, known for his achievements in the men's javelin throw. He is the reigning Olympic champion and World champion in this event. He is the first Asian athlete to win an Olympic gold medal in javelin and the first Asian to win gold in his event at the World Championship. Chopra is also the first track and field athlete to win a gold medal for India at the Olympics.
childhood: Neeraj Chopra was born in a Haryanvi Ror family in Khandra, a village in Panipat, Haryana. He has two sisters and his family is largely involved in agriculture. He did his schooling from BVN Public School and graduated from Dayanand Anglo-Vedic College in Chandigarh.
professional_career: Chopra entered his first international competition in 2013. He won the gold medal at the World U20 Championships in 2016 with a world U20 record throw of 86.48 m. He participated in the 2018 Commonwealth Games and the 2018 Asian Games, winning gold medals in both. Chopra is the Indian record holder for the javelin throw and has set several national records. He won the gold medal at the Tokyo 2020 Olympics with a best throw of 87.58 m and later won the gold medal at the 2023 World Athletics Championships with a throw of 88.17 m.
